questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used to style HTML elements.

questions.question: Which selector targets an element with class 'intro'?
questions.explanation: Class selectors use a dot (.) prefix, so .intro targets elements with class='intro'.

questions.question: In the box model, what is padding?
questions.explanation: Padding is the space inside the box, between the content and the border.

questions.question: What does display: flex do?
questions.explanation: display: flex creates a flexible container that enables flexbox layout.

questions.question: Which property centers content horizontally in Flexbox?
questions.explanation: justify-content controls alignment along the main axis (horizontal in row direction).

questions.question: What is the default value of box-sizing?
questions.explanation: The default box-sizing is content-box, where width only includes content, not padding/border.

questions.question: Name three ways to specify colors in CSS.
questions.explanation: CSS colors can be specified using named colors (red, blue), hex (#FF5733), RGB (rgb(255,87,51)), RGBA (with transparency), HSL, and HSLA.

questions.question: What is the difference between margin and padding?
questions.explanation: Margin is space outside the border (between elements), while padding is space inside the border (between content and border).
